de.must.markup
Class TabButtonGroupForJsp

java.lang.Object
  de.must.markup.MustInputField
      de.must.markup.TabButtonGroupForJsp
All Implemented Interfaces:
Markupable
public class TabButtonGroupForJsp
extends MustInputField

JTabbedPane equivalent for JSPs. Helps to divide large pages into multiple areas controlled by tab images. Needs

and <%= butler.HIDDEN_PANEL_FIELD %> in JSP What's specific to JSPs? It is not guaranteed that Butler and JSP grouping of input elements is synchronized. Therefore we do not assign input elements to tab areas at all. Thus, the butler will ask components to fetch their values from request which are not laid-out. They'll just keep their state. Butler snippets: 

  ...
  tabButtonGroup = new TabButtonGroupForJsp(new String[] {"../../images/tab1_aktiv.gif", "../../images/tab2_aktiv.gif"}, new String[] {"../../images/tab1_inaktiv.gif", "../../images/tab2_inaktiv.gif"});
  ...
  protected void handle(GeneralizedRequest request) {
    tabButtonGroup.fetchYourValueFromRequest(request);
    storables.fetchValuesFromRequest(request);
    if (okButton.wasPressed()) {
      if (storables.inputCheckOk() && isInputAccepted()) {
        storables.save();
        goBack(); return;
      }
    } else if (cancelButton.wasPressed()) {
      goBack(); return;
    } else if (tabButtonGroup.wasUsed()) {
      // nothing to do - and don't reload, we want to keep user input!
      return;
    } else {
      String idString = request.getParameter("ID");
      if (idString != null) {
        storables.loadValues(Integer.parseInt(idString));
      } else {
        storables.newInput();
      }
    }
  }
  ...
and JSP snippet: 
 
    
    
    <%switch (butler.tabButtonGroup.getSelectedIndex()) { case 0: %>
    
    <%break; case 1:%>
    
    <%}%>
    

    

    <%=butler.tabButtonGroup%>
    

    Field 1:<%=butler.field1%>
    

    Field 2:<%=butler.field2%>
    

    Field 3:<%=butler.field3%%>
    

    Field 4:<%=butler.field4%%>
    

    
<%=butler.okButton%> <%=butler.cancelButton%>
    <%= butler.HIDDEN_PANEL_FIELD %>

public TabButtonGroupForJsp(java.lang.String[] unanimatedTabImages)

Parameters:
activeTabImages - array of images to be used when item become active
inactiveTabImages - array of images to be used when item are inactive

wasUsed

public boolean wasUsed()
Returns true if user input was switching to any other tabbed pane. In this case we must not reload form data because we want to keep user input.

Returns:
true if user input was switching to any other tabbed pane

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from interface: Markupable
Destroys the markupable. Useful to release e.g. static references which prevent the garbage collector from finalizing. For example HalfDataComboBoxes add themeselves as Listeners to database changes. These listeners are registered statically. Thus, these listeners cannot be removed by the garbage collector, they have to be removed manually. This may be done by calling this destroy method.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Markupable
Overrides:
destroy in class MustInputField
See Also:
Markupable.destroy()
